meaningMnemonic: If you're on the edge of a <radical>cliff</radical> with a <radical>snake</radical>, that's a <kanji>misfortune</kanji>. You're hanging off the edge of this cliff and you can't pull yourself back up. Then you notice a snake approaching your fingers, looking like it's gonna bite you. What a misfortune!
readingMnemonic: Despite your <kanji>misfortune</kanji>, you decide to take your chances and let go of the cliff. Amazingly, a <reading>yak</reading> (やく) runs below you and catches you as you fall. Saved by the yak!
